title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 255.125 - Design of copper pipe
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 255.125 - Design of copper pipe

State Regulations
(a) Copper
pipe used in mains must have a minimum wall thickness of 0.065 inch (1.65
millimeters) and must be hard drawn. (b) Copper pipe used in service lines must
have a minimum wall thickness as specified for type "L" pipe in ASTM B
88. (c) Copper pipe used in mains
and service lines may not be used at pressures in excess of 100 psig (689
kPa). (d) Copper pipe that does not
have an internal corrosion resistant lining may not be used to carry gas that
has an average hydrogen sulfide content of more than 0.3 grains per 100
standard cubic feet (2.83 cubic meters) of gas. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16
ยง
255.125

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
